terms.योनिश्च: yoniḥ cha - Moreover, the source or origin,

meaning: This verse is from the Brahma Sutras, which are part of the Vedanta school of philosophy. In this particular verse, it states that the yoni, which refers to the source or origin, is indeed sung about. The word "yoni" can have various interpretations, but in the context of the Brahma Sutras, it refers to the Supreme Reality or the cause of the universe. The verse suggests that this ultimate source or origin is often glorified or praised. Overall, this verse emphasizes the importance of recognizing and praising the ultimate source of all beings and existence.
